intro: Galium caripense, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features thin, wiry stems that often lie close to the ground, with small, opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped. Its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium caripense is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
